org.kocakosm.pitaya.util

Class BigEndian

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kocakosm.pitaya.util.BigEndian

  • public final class BigEndian
extends Object
    Big-endian encoding and decoding.
    Author:
    Osman KOCAK

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int decodeInt(byte[] in)
      Decodes the first 4 bytes of the given array into an int value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
      static int decodeInt(byte[] in, int off)
      Decodes the first 4 bytes starting at off of the given array into an int value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
      static long decodeLong(byte[] in)
      Decodes the first 8 bytes of the given array into a long value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
      static long decodeLong(byte[] in, int off)
      Decodes the first 8 bytes starting at off of the given array into a long value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
      static byte[] encode(int n)
      Encodes the given int value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
      static void encode(int n, byte[] out, int off)
      Encodes the given int value using big-endian byte ordering convention into the given array, starting at the given offset.
      static byte[] encode(long n)
      Encodes the given long value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
      static void encode(long n, byte[] out, int off)
      Encodes the given long value using big-endian byte ordering convention into the given array, starting at the given offset.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • encode

        public static byte[] encode(int n)
        Encodes the given int value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
        Parameters:
        n - the int value to encode.
        Returns:
        the encoded value.

      • encode

        public static void encode(int n,
                          byte[] out,
                          int off)
        Encodes the given int value using big-endian byte ordering convention into the given array, starting at the given offset.
        Parameters:
        n - the int value to encode.
        out - the output buffer.
        off - the output offset.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if out is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off is negative or if out's length is lower than off + 4.

      • encode

        public static byte[] encode(long n)
        Encodes the given long value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
        Parameters:
        n - the long value to encode.
        Returns:
        the encoded value.

      • encode

        public static void encode(long n,
                          byte[] out,
                          int off)
        Encodes the given long value using big-endian byte ordering convention into the given array, starting at the given offset.
        Parameters:
        n - the long value to encode.
        out - the output buffer.
        off - the output offset.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if out is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off is negative or if out's length is lower than off + 8.

      • decodeInt

        public static int decodeInt(byte[] in)
        Decodes the first 4 bytes of the given array into an int value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
        Parameters:
        in - the encoded value.
        Returns:
        the decoded int value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if in's length is lower than 4.

      • decodeInt

        public static int decodeInt(byte[] in,
                            int off)
        Decodes the first 4 bytes starting at off of the given array into an int value using big-endian byte ordering convention.
        Parameters:
        in - the encoded value.
        off - the input offset.
        Returns:
        the decoded int value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off is negative or if in's length is lower than off + 4.

        off - the input offset.
